intro: Rinorea iliaspaiei, commonly known as the red-stemmed rinorea, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, often reddish stems and clusters of small, pink to purple flowers. Its leaves are typically ovate to elliptic in shape, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Rinorea iliaspaiei is often found in humid, shaded environments, growing in moist soils along stream banks or in forest understories.
